titles: An elegy on that famous oracle of law, and unbias'd dispenser of justice, the most learned and no less religious Sr. Matthew Hale, Kt. The late lord chief justice of England, who departed this life on Christmas-day last, at his house in Atherly in Glocester-shire.
publisher: Printed for Ben. Harris, in Sweethings-Ally, by the Royal Exchange,
notes: Verse: "Great Hale a fortnight dead! and none proclaim".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Hale, Matthew, --  Sir, 1609-1676 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
